column4: Anybody knows how to still get the best wine release package for an unsupported Ubuntu 7.04 (RAM size matters to me)?
I would if its requirement was not so demanding. Nowadays, most Linux distributions just go for the 'latest' (yet also unstable) things.
if that's too much then don't use gnome and use lighter alternatives for your programs.  If that's too much of a hassle, then ubuntu is not the right distro for you
how much by the way? I intend to follow up with alternate releases (as they work with my 7.04 and 8.04 experience).
but no way will a desktop be even semi-usable with 64mb despite what that document says...
thank you for your help, jrib. I think I am not sure what RAM really means, but I was just following the CD instructions...
how much ram do you have?
for my laptop, I have 3.00 GB of RAM. It's those new computers. What I was aiming for are those older computers.
how much on the older ones?
I'll be right back (am checking on the most oldest system I have).
and then will make an estimate.
